Rajasthan.name: Jantar Mantar, Jaipur
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Jantar Mantar in Jaipur is a collection of 19 astronomical instruments built in the early 18th century. It features the world's largest stone sundial and is a UNESCO World Heritage site, demonstrating the technological advancements of its time in celestial observations.

Rajasthan.name: Chittorgarh Fort
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Chittorgarh Fort is an iconic fort located in southern Rajasthan, known for its massive structure and history of Rajput valor. It has witnessed multiple sieges and is famous for the stories of courage and sacrifice. It was the capital of Mewar and hosts several palaces, towers, and temples.

Rajasthan.name: Kumbhalgarh Fort
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Kumbhalgarh Fort is located in the Rajsamand district of Rajasthan and is known for its massive 36-kilometer-long wall, second only to the Great Wall of China. The fort was built by Rana Kumbha in the 15th century and is nestled in the Aravalli Hills, offering stunning views.

Rajasthan.name: Ranthambore Fort
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Ranthambore Fort is situated inside the Ranthambore National Park in Sawai Madhopur, Rajasthan. The fort has historical significance and was a strategic location in battles. Today, it's known for being located within one of Indiaâ€™s most famous tiger reserves.

Rajasthan.name: Gagron Fort
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Gagron Fort is a unique fort located in the Jhalawar district of Rajasthan. It is a rare example of a hill and water fort, as it is surrounded by the Ahu and Kali Sindh rivers, providing natural defense. The fort has been a witness to numerous battles and historical events.

Rajasthan.name: Amer Fort
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Amer Fort, located in Jaipur, is a majestic fort built with red sandstone and marble. It is known for its artistic elements, including the Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace) and intricate carvings. It was once the residence of the Rajput Maharajas and is a major tourist attraction.

Rajasthan.name: Jaisalmer Fort
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Jaisalmer Fort, also known as the Golden Fort, is one of the few living forts in the world, with thousands of people still residing within its walls. Built from yellow sandstone, it blends with the desert landscape and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Rajasthan.name: Keoladeo National Park
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Keoladeo National Park, formerly known as Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary, is a man-made wetland in Rajasthan. It is home to over 375 species of birds and is a major wintering ground for migratory birds, including endangered species like the Siberian Crane.

Rajasthan.name: Jaipur City (The Pink City)
Rajasthan.detailed_description: Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan, is renowned for its urban planning and pink-colored buildings. Founded in 1727, the city is designed with broad streets and organized sectors, making it one of the earliest planned cities in India. It is famous for its palaces, forts, and rich cultural heritage.

Maharashtra.name: Ajanta Caves
Maharashtra.detailed_description: The Ajanta Caves are 30 rock-cut Buddhist cave monuments dating from the 2nd century BCE. These caves are famous for their ancient Indian art, including paintings and sculptures that depict the Jataka tales.

Maharashtra.name: Ellora Caves
Maharashtra.detailed_description: Ellora Caves are an impressive complex of rock-cut temples representing Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism. The site contains 34 caves, with the Kailasa temple being the most prominent and an outstanding example of Indian rock-cut architecture.

Maharashtra.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (Victoria Terminus)
Maharashtra.detailed_description: A historic railway station in Mumbai, the Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (formerly Victoria Terminus) is a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its Victorian Gothic Revival architecture, blending Indian and British influences.

Maharashtra.name: Elephanta Caves
Maharashtra.detailed_description: Elephanta Caves are a network of sculpted caves located on Elephanta Island, near Mumbai. They primarily represent Shaivism, with intricate sculptures, including a massive 20-foot statue of Trimurti Sadashiva.

Maharashtra.name: Western Ghats
Maharashtra.detailed_description: The Western Ghats are one of the world's eight hotspots of biological diversity. Spanning across multiple states, including Maharashtra, the region is home to thousands of species of flora and fauna, many of which are endemic to the area.

Maharashtra.name: Kaas Plateau
Maharashtra.detailed_description: Kaas Plateau is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in the Western Ghats. It is renowned for its seasonal blooms of wildflowers and a wide variety of endemic plants and insects.

Uttar Pradesh.name: Taj Mahal
Uttar Pradesh.detailed_description: The Taj Mahal is an iconic white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal. It is renowned for its stunning architecture and is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Uttar Pradesh.name: Agra Fort
Uttar Pradesh.detailed_description: Agra Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Agra. It is a massive red sandstone fort built by Mughal Emperor Akbar and served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors until the capital was moved to Delhi.

Uttar Pradesh.name: Fatehpur Sikri
Uttar Pradesh.detailed_description: Fatehpur Sikri is a historic city founded by Mughal Emperor Akbar. It served as the Mughal capital for a brief period and is known for its well-preserved buildings and architectural significance. It is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Uttar Pradesh.name: Varanasi Ghats
Uttar Pradesh.detailed_description: The Ghats of Varanasi are a series of steps leading down to the river Ganges. They are significant in Hindu culture and are famous for their vibrant religious rituals and ceremonies.

Uttar Pradesh.name: Sarnath
Uttar Pradesh.detailed_description: Sarnath is an important Buddhist site where Gautama Buddha gave his first sermon. It is home to several stupas and the famous Ashoka Pillar.

Gujarat.name: Rani ki Vav
Gujarat.detailed_description: Rani ki Vav is an intricately designed stepwell in Patan, Gujarat. It is renowned for its elaborate architecture and has been designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Gujarat.name: Gir National Park
Gujarat.detailed_description: Gir National Park is the last refuge of the Asiatic Lion. It is a significant conservation area in Gujarat known for its diverse flora and fauna.

Gujarat.name: Sun Temple
Gujarat.detailed_description: The Sun Temple at Modhera is a 11th-century Hindu temple dedicated to the Sun God, Surya. The temple is renowned for its exquisite carvings and architectural brilliance.

Gujarat.name: Sabarmati Ashram
Gujarat.detailed_description: Sabarmati Ashram was one of the residences of Mahatma Gandhi during the Indian freedom struggle. It is now a museum dedicated to his life and work.

Gujarat.name: Dwarka
Gujarat.detailed_description: Dwarka is an ancient city and a major Hindu pilgrimage site, associated with Lord Krishna. It is known for the Dwarkadhish Temple and its historical significance.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Shimla
Himachal Pradesh.detailed_description: Shimla, the capital of Himachal Pradesh, is a popular hill station known for its colonial architecture, pleasant climate, and scenic beauty.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Manali
Himachal Pradesh.detailed_description: Manali is a picturesque hill station in Himachal Pradesh, renowned for its adventure sports, scenic landscapes, and the nearby Solang Valley.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Dharamshala
Himachal Pradesh.detailed_description: Dharamshala is known for its Tibetan culture and monasteries. It is also the residence of the Dalai Lama and is a popular destination for spiritual seekers.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Kullu
Himachal Pradesh.detailed_description: Kullu is a scenic valley known for its beautiful landscapes, temples, and as a base for trekking and adventure activities.

Uttarakhand.name: Jim Corbett National Park
Uttarakhand.detailed_description: Jim Corbett National Park is the oldest national park in India and is famous for its population of Bengal tigers. It is located in the Nainital district of Uttarakhand.

Uttarakhand.name: Rishikesh
Uttarakhand.detailed_description: Rishikesh, known as the 'Yoga Capital of the World,' is famous for its spiritual and adventure tourism, including yoga retreats, river rafting, and the Ganga Aarti.

Uttarakhand.name: Haridwar
Uttarakhand.detailed_description: Haridwar is a sacred city in Uttarakhand where the River Ganges leaves the mountains and enters the plains. It is known for the Ganga Aarti performed at the ghats and its significance in Hinduism.

Uttarakhand.name: Dehradun
Uttarakhand.detailed_description: Dehradun is the capital of Uttarakhand and is known for its pleasant climate, educational institutions, and proximity to the Himalayan foothills.

Assam.name: Kaziranga National Park
Assam.detailed_description: Kaziranga National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage site in Assam, known for its population of one-horned rhinoceroses and diverse wildlife.

Assam.name: Majuli
Assam.detailed_description: Majuli is the largest river island in the world, located on the Brahmaputra River. It is known for its vibrant culture, monasteries, and festivals.

Assam.name: Manas National Park
Assam.detailed_description: Manas National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Assam, known for its rich biodiversity and its population of the endangered Assam Roofed Turtle.

Bihar.name: Bodh Gaya
Bihar.detailed_description: Bodh Gaya is a major Buddhist pilgrimage site where Gautama Buddha is said to have attained enlightenment. The Mahabodhi Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is the focal point of the site.

Bihar.name: Nalanda University
Bihar.detailed_description: Nalanda University was an ancient center of learning in Bihar, renowned for its vast library and scholars. It was one of the first residential universities in the world.

Bihar.name: Patna
Bihar.detailed_description: Patna is the capital of Bihar and has historical significance as the ancient city of Pataliputra. It is known for its rich cultural heritage and historical monuments.

Jammu & Kashmir.name: Srinagar
Jammu & Kashmir.detailed_description: Srinagar is known for its beautiful gardens, houseboats, and the Dal Lake. It is a popular destination for tourists seeking natural beauty and tranquility.

Jammu & Kashmir.name: Leh-Ladakh
Jammu & Kashmir.detailed_description: Leh-Ladakh is known for its stunning landscapes, high-altitude desert, and Buddhist monasteries. It is a popular destination for adventure enthusiasts and nature lovers.

Jammu & Kashmir.name: Jammu
Jammu & Kashmir.detailed_description: Jammu is the winter capital of Jammu & Kashmir and is known for its temples and as a gateway to the Himalayas. It serves as a significant cultural and administrative center.

Haryana.name: Sultanpur National Park
Haryana.detailed_description: Sultanpur National Park is a renowned bird sanctuary in Haryana, attracting bird watchers and nature enthusiasts. It is home to various species of migratory and resident birds.

Haryana.name: Kurukshetra
Haryana.detailed_description: Kurukshetra is an ancient city famous for its significance in the Mahabharata. It is a major Hindu pilgrimage site with several temples and sacred water tanks.

Haryana.name: Pinjore Gardens
Haryana.detailed_description: Pinjore Gardens is a historical garden complex in Haryana, known for its Mughal-style landscaping and architecture. It features terraced levels, water fountains, and lush greenery.

Madhya Pradesh.name: Khajuraho Temples
Madhya Pradesh.detailed_description: The Khajuraho Temples are famous for their intricate erotic sculptures and are a UNESCO World Heritage site. They represent a blend of Hindu and Jain architecture and art.

Madhya Pradesh.name: Sanchi Stupa
Madhya Pradesh.detailed_description: Sanchi Stupa is a significant Buddhist site in Madhya Pradesh, known for its ancient stupas, temples, and monasteries. The Great Stupa is a major attraction and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Madhya Pradesh.name: Bandhavgarh National Park
Madhya Pradesh.detailed_description: Bandhavgarh National Park is known for its high density of Bengal tigers and rich biodiversity. It is a popular destination for wildlife enthusiasts and photographers.
